_header: What so be that I say pardee
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 26) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
WHat so be that y say pardeOf loue or of his gret
                    rigure…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Yet this for trouthe y yow ensureA lady haue y chosen
                    me
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
